image.altText: Adam Britton stands by greenery wearing a green shirt

props.synopsis: The details of the offending, described as "grotesque cruelty", have the potential to cause "nervous shock or some other adverse psychological reaction to a person exposed to those details", a Supreme Court judge says.

title.children: Prominent crocodile expert pleads guilty to dozens of bestiality charges

image.altText: Several adults surround and hold down a boy in a padded room. The adults are wearing helmets.

props.synopsis: Children with autism spent hours with staff in padded rooms, where they were sometimes sat on and held down by adults as part of a controversial NDIS-funded therapy.

title.children: When this boy with autism had an 'uncontrolled behaviour', six adults in helmets descended on him

image.altText: A NT Police car parked by the side of the road, outside the Darwin Local Court.

props.synopsis: The officer — who cannot be named for legal reasons — was arrested on Friday and charged with sexual intercourse without consent, choking, strangling or suffocating in a domestic relationship and aggravated assault.

title.children: NT police officer denied bail after being charged with rape, assault

image.altText: Lachie Neale smiles and holds up the Brownlow Medal

props.synopsis: Brisbane's Lachie Neale wins his second Brownlow Medal, capping a stellar season by edging Collingwood's Nick Daicos and Western Bulldogs' Marcus Bontempelli in a thrilling count.

title.children: Neale wins his second Brownlow, edging Bontempelli, Daicos in thrilling count

image.altText: A woman pushes Natasha Fyles with one hand and pushes a paper plate into her face with the other hand

props.synopsis: Natasha Fyles says she is "in a bit of pain" after she was allegedly "given a good whack" with a cream-covered pancake on Sunday. It comes after police charged a 56-year-old woman with aggravated assault over the attack.

title.children: Bruised NT chief minister hits out at political violence after market pancake incident

image.altText: A man with glasses and a navy blue suit and tie stands behind a lecturn at a business conference

props.synopsis: The Australian and International Pilots Association (AIPA) is calling for Qantas chairman Richard Goyder to step down following what it says in one of the most damaging periods in the airline's history — the first time the organisation has made such a demand.

title.children: Pilots call for Qantas chairman Richard Goyder to step down amid low morale

image.altText: wide view of car on roof with firefighters closeby

props.synopsis: A provisional driver flips a car onto its roof at a busy Sydney beach after pressing the accelerator while practising parking.

title.children: P-plater practising parking plunges car onto popular Sydney beach

image.altText: Tracey Johnston wears her firefighting uniform and sits in the back seat of a fire truck.

props.synopsis: As firefighters prepare for the hottest and driest conditions since the Black Summer bushfires, there's a push to reduce our reliance on the defence force.

title.children: Tracey is one of six firefighters in a town that'll swell to 10,000 over summer. She's struggling to recruit volunteers

image.altText: Mike Pezzullo listens as Peter Dutton talks

props.synopsis: The secretary of the Home Affairs Department, Mike Pezzullo, is asked to step down as an investigation is conducted into text messages he is alleged to have sent to Liberal Party powerbroker, Scott Briggs.

title.children: Home Affairs secretary Mike Pezzullo stood aside after alleged texts to Liberal powerbroker

image.altText: Two people holding hands in a hospital.

props.synopsis: The case, detailed in the first annual report by the Voluntary Assisted Dying (VAD) Review Board, is the subject of review by Queensland Health.

title.children: Investigation into death of man who took voluntary assisted dying drug prescribed for his terminally-ill wife

image.altText: A white, green and blue Air Vanuatu plane in the sky above the blue Pacific ocean

props.synopsis: Vanuatu's national carrier has grounded its only international aircraft due to engineering issues, triggering cancellations and delays for up to 800 people.

title.children: 'It is so disappointing': Couple separated, hundreds stranded as Air Vanuatu grounds multiple flights

image.altText: Police vehicles parked on the side of a highway.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police are investigating a fatal crash involving a truck and a car in Alice Springs early this morning.

title.children: Man in his 40s dies in collision between truck and sedan in Alice Springs

image.altText: An almost grey scale illustration of the exterior of Don Dale. Barbed wire is highlighted in red.

props.synopsis: The government has challenged a recent NT Supreme Court decision to award four former detainees almost $1 million in damages, which the judge said showed "the court's disapproval of unlawful force being used on children or youths in detention".

title.children: NT government appealing 'manifestly excessive' damages to former Don Dale detainees

image.altText: A photo of a ferret's mouth with an arrow pointing to a new tooth in the middle of the jaw.

props.synopsis: The team, funded by Kyoto University, say it wants to begin human clinical trials in less than a year.

title.children: Japanese scientists developing drug to grow new teeth in humans

image.altText: Three people in blue and white clothing place a dark grey capsule on a sheet of plastic in the middle of the desert.

props.synopsis: A NASA space capsule carrying the largest soil sample ever scooped up from the surface of an asteroid has returned to Earth. Now hundreds of scientists across the globe are set to analyse the specimen in the hope of answering questions about ancient life.

title.children: NASA has collected the largest asteroid sample to date. Here's why it's significant and how Australia is involved

image.altText: Three ships by a floating sea barrier.

props.synopsis: The Philippines foreign ministry says the barriers are a violation of international law and it will "take all appropriate measures to protect our country's sovereignty and the livelihood of our fisherfolk".

title.children: Philippines vows to remove barrier in South China Sea, accuses Beijing of violating fishing rights

image.altText: A building facade behind tree branches

props.synopsis: A mental health service did "nothing meaningful" to support a woman who later took her life, a coroner says, finding her case was discussed five times — but her file was ultimately transferred and her name scrubbed off a whiteboard.

title.children: A woman needed help, but her name was instead scrubbed off a whiteboard. Then she took her own life

image.altText: Tasha Jordan and Ken Belbin standing next to the Golden Homes sign.

props.synopsis: Two families who sank their life savings into building their dream homes are unable to move in, with one family left living in a shed and the other couch-surfing.

title.children: 'An interesting form of construction!': Surveyors say that Tasha's home is not built to code, but no-one will fix it

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese wearing a Yes hooded sweatshirt during a press conference.

props.synopsis: Politicians from across the divide will be involved in developing the Voice to Parliament if the referendum succeeds, but the opposition has cast doubt on the process.

title.children: Prime minister proposes joint parliamentary committee if Voice is successful

image.altText: Ancient looking skeletons on display

props.synopsis: Researchers say a newly named species of prehistoric crocodile that once roamed central Australia "would've eaten whatever it wanted".

title.children: Eight-million-year-old outback predator named in honour of its hunting prowess

image.altText: Federal Treasurer Jim Chalmers speaking to media

props.synopsis: The federal government releases new a definition of "full employment" to reflect the modern labour market, saying it needs to be conscious of underemployment.

title.children: 'Full employment' will be redefined to reflect modern labour market, the Employment White Paper has found

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and sunglasses, with head bowed and arms crossed.

props.synopsis: Recordings of phone calls between parents of a boy who drowned in a river has been played during a manslaughter trial in Townsville.

title.children: Covert phone recordings aired in court as mum faces trial for sons' drowning deaths

image.altText: a dead whale

props.synopsis: A shark warning is in effect for waters around Table Island, 80 kilometres east of Esperance in southern WA, where a whale carcass has become beached.

title.children: Warnings to stay alert for sharks after 18m-long whale carcass washes up on popular beach

image.altText: A Wallabies player shows his disappointment after the loss to Wales at the Rugby World Cup.

props.synopsis: With the Wallabies all but confirmed to miss the Rugby World Cup quarterfinals, Australian rugby needs to reassess where it stands at every level of the game if it's to once again return to its glory days, writes Luke Pentony.

title.children: The Wallabies' worst-ever World Cup performance was caused by years of grassroots neglect by Rugby Australia

image.altText: Sophia Loren smiles in formal wear on a red carpet

props.synopsis: The 89-year-old Italian actor reportedly suffered multiple fractures, including a serious fracture of the femur.

title.children: Actor Sophia Loren undergoes emergency surgery after suffering multiple fractures from fall

image.altText: A composite image with a white man in police uniform on the left and a smiling black man on the right

props.synopsis: The British Ministry of Defence has been asked to put soldiers on stand-by in case they are needed to support police in London, where more than 100 officers have handed in their weapons in response to a colleague being charged with murder for fatally shooting an unarmed black man.

title.children: London police hand in guns after officer charged with murder

image.altText: An woman with a serious expression at a press conference

props.synopsis: Twenty-year-old Ilysha Perry remains in hospital in a serious but stable condition after being stabbed on campus at the Australian National University.

title.children: 'Not my precious baby': Mother of ANU stabbing victim feared she wouldn't get to the hospital in time

image.altText: A crowd of fans wearing black and white celebrate in the stands, with several Collingwood signs among them.

props.synopsis: Heated debate over AFL grand final tickets has been kicked off this week after some Collingwood members raised concerns about missing out.

title.children: Why the AFL grand final ticket allocation has some Magpies fans upset

image.altText: Kylie Minogue wearing a red dress and long red gloves, looking away from the camera with hand on hip and longish blonde hair

props.synopsis: With a new album, the anthem of the year and a major Las Vegas residency, Kylie Minogue is as unstoppable as ever. So how does she keep doing it again and again? The Australian superstar shares that and more while speaking with ABC News Breakfast.

title.children: Kylie Minogue holds the crown as Queen of pop and the dance floor with another megahit single out
